text:
cannot the `@constraint` macro from `IntervalConstraintProgramming` handle numerical expressions such as `1/3` `sqrt(3)` and so on?
```
julia> c1 = @constraint x+y<3/2
ERROR: LoadError: TypeError: in Interval, in T, expected T<:Real, got Type{Expr}
Stacktrace:
 [1] ..(::Float64, ::Expr) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\IntervalArithmetic\odPjL\src\intervals\intervals.jl:144
 [2] parse_comparison(::Expr) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\IntervalConstraintProgramming\CQFKf\src\separator.jl:88
 [3] @constraint(::LineNumberNode, ::Module, ::Expr, ::Any) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\IntervalConstraintProgramming\CQFKf\src\separator.jl:185 (repeats 2 times)
in expression starting at REPL[4]:1

julia> c1 = @constraint x+y<sqrt(3)
ERROR: LoadError: TypeError: in Interval, in T, expected T<:Real, got Type{Expr}
Stacktrace:
 [1] ..(::Float64, ::Expr) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\IntervalArithmetic\odPjL\src\intervals\intervals.jl:144
 [2] parse_comparison(::Expr) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\IntervalConstraintProgramming\CQFKf\src\separator.jl:88
 [3] @constraint(::LineNumberNode, ::Module, ::Expr, ::Any) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\IntervalConstraintProgramming\CQFKf\src\separator.jl:185 (repeats 2 times)
in expression starting at REPL[5]:1```

text:
ok at least ModelingToolKit can handle it
`
```julia> vars = @variables x y
(x, y)

julia> S = Separator(vars, x+y<sqrt(3))
Separator:
  - variables: x, y
  - expression: x + y == [-∞, 1.73206]```

elements.text:
ok at least ModelingToolKit can handle it
`

julia> vars = @variables x y
(x, y)

julia> S = Separator(vars, x+y<sqrt(3))
Separator:
  - variables: x, y
  - expression: x + y == [-∞, 1.73206]

text: Exactly, currently the macro doesn't handle it. I am moving away from using macros.
